Metadata: Investigations of the Terminal Island Treatment Plant Effluent and Fish Processing Wastes in Outer Los Angeles Harbor, 1981-1982
Allan Hancock Foundation and University of Southern California Sea Grant
program reports (annual, progress, planning reports, etc)
A Report for the City of Los Angeles, Department of Public Works; Marine Studies of San Pedro bay, California Part 19
Blank pages were not picked up by the scanner that were numbered in this report

The city of Los Angeles, in conjunction with than application for a new five-year permit to discharge effluent from the Terminal Island Treatment Plant (TITP) in outer Los Angeles Harbor, requested this study on several aspects related to present and future environmental management of those wastes. These included an evaluation of the harbor's capacity to assimilate more waste, an assessment of its existing biological health, and a determination of whether a change in treating and managing fish processing waste effluents would improve the harbor's quality while assuring that the projected effluent mixtures would not be toxic. Overall, the projected effects of the city's proposed activities appear relatively benign.
